00021 #ifndef _RTAI_ASM_I386_LXRT_H
00022 #define _RTAI_ASM_I386_LXRT_H

00024 #include <asm/segment.h>
00025 #include <asm/rtai_vectors.h>
00026 
00027 #define LOW  0
00028 #define HIGH 1
00029 
00030 union rtai_lxrt_t { RTIME rt; int i[2]; void *v[2]; };
00031 
00032 #ifdef __cplusplus
00033 extern "C" {
00034 #endif /* __cplusplus */
00035 
00036 #ifdef __KERNEL__
00037 
00038 #define __STR(x) #x
00039 #define STR(x) __STR(x)
00040 
00041 #define my_switch_to(prev,next,last) do {                               \
00042         asm volatile("pushl %%esi\n\t"                                  \
00043                      "pushl %%edi\n\t"                                  \
00044                      "pushl %%ebp\n\t"                                  \
00045                      "pushl %%eax\n\t"                                  \
00046                      "pushl %%edx\n\t"                                  \
00047                      "movl %%esp,%0\n\t"        /* save ESP */          \
00048                      "movl %3,%%esp\n\t"        /* restore ESP */       \
00049                      "movl $1f,%1\n\t"          /* save EIP */          \
00050                      "pushl %4\n\t"             /* restore EIP */       \
00051                      "jmp *"SYMBOL_NAME_STR(rthal + 4)"\n"              \
00052                      "1:\t"                                             \
00053                      "popl %%edx\n\t"                                   \
00054                      "popl %%eax\n\t"                                   \
00055                      "popl %%ebp\n\t"                                   \
00056                      "popl %%edi\n\t"                                   \
00057                      "popl %%esi\n\t"                                   \
00058                      :"=m" (prev->thread.esp),"=m" (prev->thread.eip),  \
00059                       "=b" (last)                                       \
00060                      :"m" (next->thread.esp),"m" (next->thread.eip),    \
00061                       "a" (prev), "d" (next),                           \
00062                       "b" (prev));                                      \
00063 } while (0)
00064 
00065 #define RTAI_LXRT_HANDLER rtai_lxrt_handler
00066 
00067 extern struct global_rt_status global;
00068 
00069 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_TRACE
00070 /****************************************************************************/
00071 /* Trace functions. These functions have to be used rather than insert
00072 the macros as-is. Otherwise the system crashes ... You've been warned. K.Y. */
00073 extern void trace_true_lxrt_rtai_syscall_entry(void);
00074 extern void trace_true_lxrt_rtai_syscall_exit(void);
00075 /****************************************************************************/
00076 #endif
00077 
00078 extern volatile unsigned long lxrt_hrt_flags;
00079 
00080 static inline void rtai_lxrt_handler_asm(void)
00081 {
00082         int ptr;
00083         __asm__ __volatile__ (
00084                 "pushl %%eax\n\t"
00085                 "cld\n\t"
00086                 "pushl %%es\n\t"
00087                 "pushl %%ds\n\t"
00088                 "pushl %%eax\n\t"
00089                 "pushl %%ebp\n\t"
00090                 "pushl %%edi\n\t"
00091                 "pushl %%esi\n\t"
00092                 "pushl %%edx\n\t"
00093                 "pushl %%ecx\n\t"
00094                 "pushl %%ebx\n\t"
00095                 "pushl %%edx\n\t"
00096                 "pushl %%eax\n\t"
00097                 "movl $" STR(__KERNEL_DS) ",%%ebx\n\t"
00098                 "mov %%bx,%%ds\n\t"
00099                 "mov %%bx,%%es\n\t"
00100 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_TRACE
00101                 "call "SYMBOL_NAME_STR(trace_true_lxrt_rtai_syscall_entry)"\n\t"
00102 #endif
00103                 "call "SYMBOL_NAME_STR(lxrt_handler)"\n\t"
00104                 "addl $8,%%esp;\n\t"
00105                 "movl %%edx,8(%%esp);\n\t"
00106                 "movl %%eax,24(%%esp);\n\t"
00107 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_TRACE
00108                 "call "SYMBOL_NAME_STR(trace_true_lxrt_rtai_syscall_exit)";\n\t"
00109 #endif
00110                 ::);
00111 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_ADEOS
00112         {
00113         static int lxrt_test_context(void);
00114         ptr = lxrt_test_context();
00115         }
00116 #else /* CONFIG_RTHAL */
00117         ptr = test_bit(hard_cpu_id(), &lxrt_hrt_flags) || !test_bit(hard_cpu_id(), &global.used_by_linux);
00118 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_ADEOS */
00119         __asm__ __volatile__ (
00120                 "testl %%eax,%%eax;\n\t"
00121                 "jz 1f\n\t"
00122                 "popl %%ebx\n\t"
00123                 "popl %%ecx\n\t"
00124                 "popl %%edx\n\t"
00125                 "popl %%esi\n\t"
00126                 "popl %%edi\n\t"
00127                 "popl %%ebp\n\t"
00128                 "popl %%eax\n\t"
00129                 "popl %%ds\n\t"
00130                 "popl %%es\n\t"
00131                 "addl $4,%%esp\n\t"
00132                 "iret\n\t"
00133                 "1:call *" SYMBOL_NAME_STR(rthal + 16) "\n\t"
00134                 "jmp *" SYMBOL_NAME_STR(rthal)
00135                 : : "a" (ptr));
00136 }
00137 
00138 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_ADEOS
00139 #define DEFINE_LXRT_HANDLER \
00140 static int lxrt_test_context(void) { \
00141     return test_bit(hard_cpu_id(), &lxrt_hrt_flags) || test_bit(hard_cpu_id(), &arti_cpu_realtime); \
00142 } \
00143 static void rtai_lxrt_handler(void) { \
00144     rtai_lxrt_handler_asm(); \
00145 }
00146 #else /* CONFIG_RTHAL */
00147 #define DEFINE_LXRT_HANDLER \
00148 static void rtai_lxrt_handler(void) { rtai_lxrt_handler_asm(); }
00149 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_ADEOS */
00150 
00151 #define LXRT_LINUX_SYSCALL_TRAP lxrt_linux_syscall_handler
00152 
00153 #define DEFINE_LXRT_SYSCALL_HANDLER \
00154 static void lxrt_linux_syscall_handler(void) \
00155 { \
00156         __asm__ __volatile__ ( \
00157                 "push $0\n\t" \
00158                 "cld; pushl %es; pushl %ds; pushl %ebp\n\t" \
00159                 "pushl %edi; pushl %esi; pushl %ecx\n\t" \
00160                 "pushl %ebx; pushl %edx; pushl %eax\n\t" \
00161                 "movl $" STR(__KERNEL_DS) ",%ebx; mov %bx,%ds; mov %bx,%es\n\t" \
00162                 "movl " SYMBOL_NAME_STR(linux_syscall_handler) ",%ebx\n\t" \
00163                 "movl %ebx,36(%esp)" ); \
00164         __asm__ __volatile__ ("call "SYMBOL_NAME_STR(inhrtp)); \
00165         __asm__ __volatile__ ( \
00166                 "testl %eax,%eax; popl %eax; popl %edx;\n\t" \
00167                 "popl %ebx; popl %ecx; popl %esi; popl %edi\n\t" \
00168                 "popl %ebp; popl %ds; popl %es\n\t" \
00169                 "jz 1f; addl $4,%esp; movl $-38,%eax; iret; 1: ret"); \
00170 }
00171 
00172 #endif /* __KERNEL__ */
00173 
00174 static union rtai_lxrt_t _rtai_lxrt(int srq, void *arg) __attribute__ ((__unused__));
00175 static union rtai_lxrt_t _rtai_lxrt(int srq, void *arg)
00176 {
00177         union rtai_lxrt_t retval;
00178         RTAI_DO_TRAP(RTAI_LXRT_VECTOR,retval,srq,arg);
00179         return retval;
00180 }
00181 
00182 static inline int my_cs(void)
00183 {
00184         int reg; __asm__("movl %%cs,%%eax " : "=a" (reg) : ); return reg;
00185 }
00186 
00187 static inline void memxcpy(void *dst, int dseg, void *src, int sseg, int longs)
00188 {
00189         // Generalised memxcpy
00190         __asm__ __volatile (\
00191         "cld; pushl %%ds; pushl %%es;\n\t"\
00192         "movl %%edx,%%es; movl %%eax,%%ds; rep; movsl;\n\t"\
00193         "popl %%es; popl %%ds;\n\t"\
00194     :/*empty*/: "D" (dst),"S" (src),"c" (longs),"a" (sseg),"d" (dseg));
00195 }
00196 
00197 static inline void _memxcpy(void *dst, void *src, int srcseg, int longsize)
00198 {
00199         __asm__ __volatile (\
00200         "cld;pushl %%ds;movl %%eax,%%ds;rep;movsl;popl %%ds;\n\t"\
00201     :/*empty*/: "D" (dst), "S" (src), "c" (longsize), "a" (srcseg));
00202 } // Choice of registers limited by liblxrt gcc -fPIC option.
00203 
00204 static inline union rtai_lxrt_t rtai_lxrt(short int dynx, short int lsize, int srq, void *arg)
00205 {
00206         static int Arg[12]; void *pt;
00207         lsize /= sizeof(int);
00208         if(my_cs() == __KERNEL_CS) {
00209                 // With this we can reenter lxrt from a user space function.
00210                 _memxcpy( &Arg, arg, __KERNEL_DS, lsize);
00211                 pt = &Arg;
00212         } else pt = arg;
00213 
00214         return _rtai_lxrt((dynx << 28) | ((srq & 0xFFF) << 16) | lsize, pt);
00215 }
00216 
00217 #ifdef __cplusplus
00218 }
00219 #endif /* __cplusplus */
